tasks_app.models module

class tasks_app.models.Subtask(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a subtask that belongs to a specific task. It includes a name and a status.

task

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

task_id
class tasks_app.models.Task(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a task with details like title, description, due date, priority, category, and status. Tasks can be assigned to multiple AppUsers.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

assigned_to

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

task_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

tasks_app.tests module

class tasks_app.tests.SubtaskTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to subtasks, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting subtasks.

setUp()

Set up initial data, creating a test user, app user, task, subtask, and token.

test_create_subtask()

Test creating a new subtask.

test_delete_subtask()

Test deleting an existing subtask.

test_get_subtasks()

Test retrieving a list of all subtasks.

test_update_subtask()

Test updating an existing subtask.

class tasks_app.tests.TaskTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to tasks, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting tasks.

setUp()

Set up initial data, creating a test user, app user, task, subtask, and token.

test_create_task_with_subtasks()

Test creating a task along with its subtasks.

test_delete_task()

Test deleting an existing task.

test_get_tasks()

Test retrieving a list of all tasks.

test_update_task()

Test updating an existing task and its associated subtasks.

class tasks_app.views.SubtasksView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for subtasks.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a subtask by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all subtasks in the system.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new subtask and returns the created subtask.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing subtask and returns the updated subtask.

class tasks_app.views.TasksView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for tasks and their associated subtasks.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a task by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all tasks in the system.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new task with subtasks and returns the created task.

post_task_with_subtasks(task_serializer, subtasks_data)

Creates a task along with its subtasks and returns the created task.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing task and its subtasks.

put_task_with_subtasks(task_serializer, subtasks_data)

Updates a task and its subtasks, then returns the updated task.

async tasks_app.views.subtasks_stream(request)

Sends empty events to the client for subtask data update notifications.

async tasks_app.views.tasks_stream(request)

Sends empty events to the client for task data update notifications.
